text: have you ever wanted to make a dessert
and just put it aside brownie or cookie
well today I think I've solved that
problem on sweet talk we are making
chocolate chip streusel brownies these
will please both the cookie and brownie
lovers in your life and they think some
jobs on Father's Day too
I'm going to start with my dry
ingredients here I have 1 and 3/4 cup of
AP flour to that I'm adding half a
teaspoon of baking powder and half a
teaspoon of baking soda next I'll add
3/4 teaspoon of kosher salt I like to
have a little bit of a salty sweet thing
with my chocolate chip cookies I'll just
give this a quick whisk move on to my
butter and sugar here I have 1 stick of
room-temperature butter I'm adding 1/2
cup of light brown sugar make sure to
pack this in and also 1/2 a cup of
granulated sugar
I'll get the mixer going on medium high
until the butter in the sugar is
combined light and creamy this will take
about 4 min
while this is running I'm going to top
my complet
[Music]
all right butter is looking pretty good
give that a scrape down the side next
I'm adding one large egg and one
teaspoon of pure vanilla extract I'll
give this a mix on medium just until
it's combined
[Applause]
looks great now I'll give it one more
scrape now I'll add in a my dry
ingredients and add these all at once
this is just a pretty basic cocido
mix this on low just until it's mine and
when it's just about totally combined
I'm going to add my chocolate this is
six ounces of bittersweet chocolate you
could use chocolate chip for this but I
like the way that chocolate melts I
think it smells really nicely and I like
having some varying sizes of chocolate
in my cookie dough pieces this looks
delicious
I absolutely love cookie dough I mean
who doesn't right so I'm going to set
this aside clean up my station and make
my brownie batter now I'm making my
brownie batter I'm starting by melting 6
ounces of bittersweet chocolate now I'm
adding 1 stick of room-temperature
butter give this a quick stir using a
double boiler is a really gentle way of
heating your chocolate with your butter
this helps make sure that it doesn't
burn
[Music]
I'm taking this off the heat and the
first thing I'm going to do is add one
and a half cups of granulated sugar
adding the sugar first helps cool down
the chocolate mixture which means that
we won't scramble our eggs when we add
the eggs in stir this in next I'm adding
three large eggs will whisk these in one
at a time to make sure that things get
evenly incorporated looks a little
granulated right now from the sugar but
that's okay when it all bakes together
it's a really delicious sense chewy
brownie next I'm whisking in a quarter
cup of Dutch process cocoa powder
[Music]
and 1/2 teaspoon of salt finally we will
fold in our flour this is half a cup
with two tablespoons of all-purpose
flour just want to fold this until it's
just incorporated you may be thinking
why can't I just use a box mix for this
you totally could but once you try these
brownies we will never go back there so
decadent gooey rich they're really
amazing
move over box mix because there's a new
brownie in town this is ready I'm going
to get my cookie dough and we're going
to assemble our chocolate chips streusel
brownies now for the fun part
assembling our brownie cookie creation
first the brownie batter side just
spread this out to the edges I prepared
my pan with butter parchment and then
buttered it again so nothing sticks good
next I sprinkle our cookie dough all
over the top of the brownies it's okay
if there's a little space between the
cookie chunks on here because as we bake
those puffs up and we'll kind of
completely cover the top of the brownie
does that look incredible I know some of
you will probably want to eat this just
like this but I'm going to cover this
with parchment lined aluminum foil and
put it in the oven for 20 minutes remove
the foil and bake it for an additional
30 minutes until it's nice and golden
brown and has moist crumbs when you
press in with the tooth
they're ready and I am so excited to eat
them I've let them cool completely in
the pan so I'm ready to take them out
now we need to gently wiggle out of the
pan and pull it that way there it is are
you team brownie or team cookie let me
know what you think in the comments and
tell me what you think of this mashup of
two of my favorite desserts and I think
if you make these for dad on Father's
Day he is going to love them looks like
a good size to me all right I just have
to take a bite or two resist oh my
gosh look at that it is moist it's chewy
if punchy is gooey it's the best of both
worlds brownie and cookie you will never
find this in a box
